items.title: Sporting Events at the Olympic Golf Course
items.longText: From May 23 to 25, 2025, the 7th Olympic Golf Course Open—presented by IFS—will bring together over 100 golfers from across Brazil at the Olympic Golf Course, a legacy of the Rio 2016 Games. Over three days of competition (Friday the 23rd, Saturday the 24th, and Sunday the 25th), athletes in the Scratch and Handicap categories (up to 8.5; 8.6–14; 14.1–20 for men; and Scratch and up to 16 for women) will play 54 holes under the R&A Rules of St. Andrews and the CBGolfe Code of Conduct, earning points for world, national, and state rankings. Open to the public, the event also features Chef Piero’s Barbecue Festival (May 24, 1 PM–5 PM) and a grand closing show with Evandro Mesquita & Fabulous Tab (May 25, starting at 4:30 PM), preceded by a performance from Banda Quarto 17. It’s an exceptional blend of sport, gastronomy, and culture in Barra da Tijuca.

items.title: Environmental Lecture Series
items.longText: On September 11, 2024, the Rio de Janeiro State Government will host a forum at Casa G20 (Laura Alvim Cultural Center) in Ipanema dedicated to strengthening Brazil’s fertilizer supply chain. Interim Secretary Fernanda Curdi will open the event, featuring a keynote by Upendra Singh (IFDC, USA) and panel discussions with representatives from the Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Mines and Energy, BNDES, Finep, Embrapa, Sinprifert, Anda, Abisolo, Petrobras, Confap, SP Ventures, and Porto do Açu, as well as researchers from UFRJ, UFV, and IAC. The goal is to explore technological innovations, biodiversity, and food security in line with the National Fertilizer Plan 2050 and the establishment of the CEFENP Center of Excellence in the state.
details: Location: Casa G20 – Laura Alvim Cultural Center (Ipanema)
Panels with Government, Embrapa, BNDES, Finep, Petrobras, Confap
Researchers from UFRJ, UFV, and IAC

items.title: Sports & Legacy Project
items.longText: On March 15, 2025, the Sports & Legacy Project launched with the founding of the Beach Boxe & Beach Boxing Brasil Federation Ltda. The program offers regular beach-boxing training sessions for young people in vulnerable social situations along the waterfront, promoting discipline, physical and mental health, self-esteem, and community inclusion through sport.
details: Foundation of Beach Boxe & Beach Boxing Brasil Federation Ltda.
Development of discipline, confidence, and teamwork

items.title: Bay Cleanup & Governor’s Island Revitalization Drive
items.description: Lighting, Beach Cleanup, and Urban Renewal
items.longText: In just six months, under Councilman Wagner Tavares’s leadership in partnership with RioLuz, Governor’s Island received new lighting across multiple areas, enhancing safety and quality of life for residents. Previously dark streets became well-lit, while parks, courts, and recreational spaces underwent significant revitalization. For the first time, Ribeira Beach saw a pioneering sand cleanup effort, demonstrating respect for the environment and islanders. The administration continues maintenance work—from tree pruning to pothole repairs—ensuring the island is cared for as it deserves.
details: Installation of new lighting on streets and in plazas
Revitalization of courts and leisure areas
Tree pruning, pothole repairs, and maintenance actions
First-ever sand cleanup at Ribeira Beach

items.title: Aqua Bossa Nova & MPB Space
items.description: Cultural Season in Ipanema Dedicated to Bossa Nova and MPB
items.longText: In the cultural sphere, we created a dedicated space in Ipanema for Bossa Nova and Brazilian Popular Music (MPB). From October 31, 2014, to February 2016, we produced a series of concerts and musical gatherings—such as Mulheres & Beatles—celebrating sophisticated arrangements and harmonies. By the end of the season, we emphasized the importance of cultural incentive laws to expand the reach and impact of our projects.
details: Focus on Bossa Nova and MPB

items.title: Pipoca Carioca
items.description: Márcia Castro Invites Baby do Brasil, Pedro Luís & Teresa Cristina
items.longText: Singer Márcia Castro brings her Pipoca Carioca project to the Aqua stage in a multi-generational celebration of Brazilian music. On January 15, Márcia welcomes special guests Baby do Brasil, Pedro Luís, and Teresa Cristina for a free evening of pop, samba, and MPB.
details: Special guests: Baby do Brasil, Pedro Luís, Teresa Cristina

items.title: Inauguration of Rayz’s Aqua Space
items.longText: On the second floor of Rayz restaurant, Rayz’s Aqua Space opened in Ipanema with a special music and gastronomy program. Singer Leny Andrade kicked off the evenings with her MPB classics, followed by performances from Ellen Oléria, the Mulheres & Beatles quartet, American saxophonist Eddie Daniels, and Miele.
details: Line-up: Leny Andrade, Ellen Oléria, Mulheres & Beatles, Eddie Daniels, Miele
Location: Aqua Space (2nd floor of Rayz Restaurant) – corner of Farme de Amoedo and Prudente de Morais, Ipanema
Date & time: Oct 31 & Nov 1, 2014; doors open at 8:30 PM
